summary.para: The KeyExchange method returns the graphics driver's certificate.

param.name: pRandom
param.para: Receives a 128-bit random number, generated by the graphics driver. Use this value in the method.

param.name: VarLenCertGH
param.para: Receives a pointer to a buffer containing the graphics driver's certificate. The method allocates the memory for the buffer. The caller must release the memory by calling .

param.name: pdwLengthCertGH
param.para: Receives the length of the buffer returned in VarLenCertGH.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called methods in the wrong order. If this error occurs, the application should release the current instance of the VMR.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.
No monitors correspond to the display device. This error can occur if the display mode changes; or the user turns off a monitor or removes a monitor.

remarks.para: The graphics driver's certificate contains the driver's public encryption key.
If this method returns E_UNEXPECTED, the application should create a new COPP session by releasing the VMR, creating a new instance of the VMR, and calling KeyExchange again on the new instance.

summary.para: The ProtectionCommand method sends a COPP command to the graphics driver.

param.name: cmd
param.para: Pointer to an structure that contains the command.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

summary.para: The ProtectionStatus method sends a COPP status request to the graphics driver.

param.name: pStatusInput
param.para: Pointer to an structure that contains the status request.

param.name: pStatusOutput
param.para: Pointer to an structure. The method fills this structure with the driver's response.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

summary.para: The SessionSequenceStart method initiates the COPP session with the graphics driver.

param.name: pSig
param.para: Pointer to an structure. Fill this structure as described in the Remarks session.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

remarks.para: To fill in the structure for the pSig parameter, first concatenate the following numbers:

item.description: The 128-bit number returned in the pRandom parameter of the method.
Data integrity session key. This value is a 128-bit random number generated by the application.
Starting sequence number for COPP status requests. This value is a 32-bit random number generated by the application.
Starting sequence number for COPP commands. This value is a 32-bit random number generated by the application.

remarks.para: Then encrypt this number with 2048-bit RSA encryption using the graphics driver's public encryption key. The public encryption key is contained in the certificate returned in the VarLenCertGH parameter of the KeyExchange method.

summary.para: The IAMCertifiedOutputProtection interface sends Certified Output Protection Protocol (COPP) messages to the graphics driver. This interface is exposed by the Video Mixing Renderer 7 (VMR-7) and Video Mixing Renderer 9 (VMR-9) filters.
For information about using COPP, see Using Certified Output Protection Protocol (COPP).
